Class Deck

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gc28.model.Deck
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Deck extends Object implements Serializable
Class that represents the deck of cards.

      public Deck(ArrayList<CardResource> deckCardResources, ArrayList<CardGold> deckCardGold, ArrayList<CardInitial> deckCardInitial, ArrayList<CardObjective> deckCardObjective) throws IOException

  • Method Details

    • shuffle

      public <T extends Card> void shuffle(ArrayList<T> card)
      this method shuffles the deck inside the parameter
      Parameters:
      card - is the deck to be shuffled

    • shuffleAll

      public void shuffleAll()
      shuffles all the decks of the game

    • nextResource

      public Optional<CardResource> nextResource()
      This method is responsible for drawing the card.
      Returns:
      the card on top of the card resource deck, if the array is not empty, removing it from the array. Otherwise, it returns null.

    • nextGold

      public Optional<CardGold> nextGold()
      This method is responsible for drawing the card.
      Returns:
      the card on top of the card gold deck, if the array is not empty, removing it from the array. Otherwise, it returns null.

    • nextObjective

      public Optional<CardObjective> nextObjective()
      This method is responsible for drawing the card.
      Returns:
      the card on top of the card objective deck, if the array is not empty, removing it from the array. Otherwise, it returns null.

    • nextInitial

      public Optional<CardInitial> nextInitial()
      This method is responsible for drawing the card.
      Returns:
      the card on top of the card initial deck, if the array is not empty, removing it from the array. Otherwise, it returns null.

    • isResEmpty

      public boolean isResEmpty()
      this method is used only for testing more easily

      this method is used only for testing more easily

    • getNextGoldCard

      public CardGold getNextGoldCard()
      This method applies a permutation to the deck of cards. Used only for testing purposes inside the special constructor.
